channel.title: Help With my Dropping Method [317]

item.title: Help With my Dropping Method [317]
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

I am using it. It 12kb, and this is the first bits of what is in it. just to prove I’m using it:

[code]import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.IOException;

public class ItemHandler {
public static int DropItemCount = 0;
public static int MaxDropShowDelay = 120; // 120 * 500 = 60000 / 1000 =
// 60s
public static int MaxListedItems = 10000;
public static int hideItemTimer = 60;
public static int MaxDropItems = 100000;

// SDID = Standard Drop Items Delay
public static int SDID = 90; // 90 * 500 = 45000 / 1000 = 45s
// Phate: Setting VARS[/code]

item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Ok, check me if I’m wrong.

I moved my existing ItemHandler out of my source and replaced it with the one you suggested, and now, the one you suggested is now my ItemHandler.

This is what comes up when I compile:

client.java:1709: non-static method itemExists(int,int,int) cannot be referenced from a static context if (ItemHandler.itemExists(apickupid, absX, absY)) { ^ client.java:1710: cannot find symbol symbol : method itemAmount(int,int,int) location: class ItemHandler int itemAmount = ItemHandler.itemAmount(apickupi d, apickupx, ^ client.java:1713: removeItem(GroundItem) in ItemHandler cannot be applied to (in t,int,int,int) ItemHandler.removeItem(apickupid, apicku px, apickupy, ^ client.java:1718: cannot find symbol symbol : method resetPickup() location: class client resetPickup(); ^ 4 errors Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Help With my Dropping Method [317]
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Replace it with this, let me know the errors you get.

public void scanPickup() { if (absX == apickupx && absY == apickupy) { if (ItemHandler.itemExists(apickupid, absX, absY)) { int itemAmount = ItemHandler.itemAmount(apickupid, apickupx, apickupy); if (addItem(apickupid, itemAmount)) { ItemHandler.removeItem(apickupid, apickupx, apickupy, itemAmount); } } else if (hasntLoggedin) { } resetPickup(); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Help With my Dropping Method [317]
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Ok, here is another thing i found that didnt show up earlier for some reason:

public void scanPickup() { if (absX == apickupx && absY == apickupy) { if (server.itemHandler.itemExists(apickupid, absX, absY)) { server.itemHandler.removeGroundItem(this, apickupid, absX, absY, true); } else if (hasntLoggedin) { } resetPickup(); } } public void resetPickup(){ apickupid = -1; apickupx = -1; apickupy = -1; }

Read full topic

item.title: Help With my Dropping Method [317]
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

@Coon
c is suppose to be the item amount, its actually not checking the height for some odd reason.

@Provoked
Apparently, the person who released this source didn’t want items dropped or picked up. It seems to me that its a delta, so why dont you look for scanPickup() and see what you can find.

Read full topic

ok, so when i replaced the c with “playerItemsN[slot]” and logged on my server, when i dropped something, I could see it!! sucess!!! but sadly when I tried to pick it up, I couldn’t…

item.title: Help With my Dropping Method [317]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Just a suggestion, from looking. I believe the C, is where the players height-level is actually wanted. If it is calling their X, and Y, but no height, then many duped could be created. I would try replacing the c with the int for heightlevel.

Read full topic
